alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 8:13PM EDT until March 31 at 6:10AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT/1115 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in Florida, Calhoun, Gadsden, Jackson and Liberty. In southwest Georgia, Decatur. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT /1115 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 PM CDT /813 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Altha, Ocheesee, Torreya State Park, Henderson Mill, Cypress, Alliance, Roy, Sink Creek, Union City, Hardin Heights, River Junction, Simsville, Sycamore, Jinks, Rosedale, Willis and White Pond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
